title: Punta Bes
text:
The Punta Bes is a 3,177 metres high <a href="mountain">mountain</a> belonging to the Italian side of <a href="Graian%20Alps">Graian Alps</a>.
Geography.
The mountain is located on the border between <a href="Piedmont">Piedmont</a> and <a href="Aosta%20Valley">Aosta Valley</a>, on the <a href="Drainage%20divide">watershed</a> dividing <a href="Valle%20dell%27Orco">Valle dell'Orco</a> from <a href="Valsavarenche">Valsavarenche</a>, the latter tributary of the <a href="Dora%20Baltea">Dora Baltea</a>. A 3.112 m high saddle divides Punta bes from <a href="Punta%20Leynir">Punta Leynir</a>, while the Orco/Valsavarenche ridge continues towards the <a href="Colle%20del%20Nivolet">Colle del Nivolet</a>. The Punta Bes, due to its location, offers a good view on the nearby <a href="massif">massif</a> of <a href="Gran%20Paradiso">Gran Paradiso</a>.

Access to the summit.
The mountain can be accessed from "<a href="Nivolet%20Pass">Nivolet Pass</a>" (2.641 m); this route requires a good <a href="hiking">hiking</a> experience. Along with Punta Bes many hikers also climb the nearby <a href="Punta%20Leynir">Punta Leynir</a>.
Nature protection.
Punta Bes belongs to the <a href="Parco%20Nazionale%20del%20Gran%20Paradiso">Parco Nazionale del Gran Paradiso</a>.
